title: Wooden Jetty
description: Wooden Jetty

title: The Perfect Curve
description: Coming from a landscape with many industrial structures, we arrive to a green peaceful area.
At the end of road lies The Perfect Curve

title: The Forbidden Territory
description: Disused platform on the river not accessible to public.
Seagulls and other birds perform an afternoon chorus.
access: Tideslea Tower, Erebus Dr, London SE28 0GB

title: Muddy Waters
description: Birds stick around the beach where light waves meet the muddy shores.
High walls make for an excellent acoustic theatre with a view.
Far in the distance, the city skyline rising high and fast!

title: Trees of Crowns
description: Crowish – or when listening to another language sounds like arguing but its really just having fun.

title: Why Are We Here
description: Rehearsal for one of the Protein dance, street events in London Woolwich arsenal.
https://proteindance.co.uk/production

title: A World Full of Fresh Hope
description: It could be a school playground, but somehow the energy is more positive and less chaotic.
The generation that will take the destiny of the planet in their hands one day, playing on the water, without a single worry in their minds and with big smiles full of hope.
Amazingly this one girl stands with a t-shirt that is indeed the slogan for all new generations: past, present and future – A World Full of Hope!

title: All on Board
description: The Woolwich Ferry is a free ferry across the River Thames in East London, connecting Woolwich on the south bank with North Woolwich on the north.
It's part of Transport for London.

title: Watergate stairs
description: Diving in the water and hovering over it.
Layers of sound intertwined, some louder some quieter, one and another time.

title: The Fiddle Player
description: Fiddle Player* at the Dog and Bell on Prince Street just off Watergate street.
This is the start of a detour in the exploration of the river side.
From the Watergate stairs there’s no further passage downstream.
* All rights reserved to the fiddle player. https://www.facebook.com/TheDogandBell/
Sonic Thames Inspired by exploring the river upstream at the height of the pandemic.
To be there, grab the whole moment and place it here – for you, all world to see.
Binaural 3D* Recording technique that offers a more natural and realistic sound experience when listened via headphones.
It provides a sense of multidirectional perception as it happens in the real world.
You have the feeling of being in the same space as the actual location, listening to the sounds coming from different directions, even from behind.
Binaural allows for a better perception of space, precisely like being in there! * headphones are not only essential - but crucial!

title: Intersection
description: Bridge meets platform.
At the intersection the screeching murmurs are surrounded by waves, breeze and wings.

title: Floating on the River
description: Greenland Pier - Uber Thames Clippers. Boats departing and arriving at the Greenland Pier.
This is a good opportunity to focus on listening to the sounds of the surrounding environment that we often ignore when traveling around.

title: Beach Below and Above
description: River activity underwater mixed with light sounds above the water.
Recorded, cleaned and amplified.
Different living creatures can be heard underwater.
What it seems to be birds are actually aquatic beings.
access: The Angel pub, 101 Bermondsey Wall E, London SE16 4NB

title: Underwater Gig
description: How would fish listen to a live performance on a boat?
Well, we recorded underwater and here’s the result! glu glu
access: The Angel pub, 101 Bermondsey Wall E, London SE16 4NB

title: Bermondsey Beach
description: Bermondsey Beach - Listening to the Thames waves looking at to the city skyline with the Tower Bridge on the background.
